business.headline: High-end electric vehicles likely to attract 18% GSTAccording to the proposals, GST on four-wheeled EVs priced between Rs 20 lakh and Rs 40 lakh will be raised from 5 per cent to 18 per cent.
Chocolates with cocoa, pastries, ice cream likely to be taxed at 5% instead of 18%The proposed rationalisation stems from the Council's broader push to simplify the GST framework.

Condensed milk, dates, jams, mushrooms, namkeens to get cheaper under GST 2.0The fitment committee has proposed that products such as butter, condensed milk, jams, mushrooms, dates, nuts, and namkeens move from the current 12 per cent GST slab to just 5 per cent.

PM SVANidhi scheme extended till 2030, higher loans and credit cards for vendorsThe move is expected to benefit 1.15 crore street vendors, including 50 lakh new beneficiaries. The scheme will continue to be implemented jointly by the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs (MoHUA) and the Department of Financial Services (DFS).

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.
Can a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP make you a crorepati? Here's the timelineCan Rs 10,000 a month really make you a crorepati? The maths of SIPs shows that with discipline and time, the answer is yes.

These 3 banks offer special FDs with higher interest rates till September 2025For those planning to invest in FDs, three banks are running special schemes with better interest rates valid up to September 2025.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growthThe 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

Filing ITR for FY 2024-25? Keep these 6 documents handyKeeping your documents in order is the first step to a smooth filing process. Not having the documents in place not only delays the process but also increases the chance of errors in the return.

Indian crypto platforms boom in grey zone, says Zerodha's Nithin KamathTraders are increasingly drawn to futures and options (F&O) products in digital assets, lured by high leverage and lower tax costs compared to traditional markets.

Trump's 50% tariff shock: How can exporters shield themselvesThe tariff was announced as a response to India's continued trade with Russia, and it now places Indian products at a disadvantage in the American market.

New to ITR filing? Here's how to create your account on the e-filing portalNew taxpayers often wonder how to start their ITR journey, and the answer is simple: create your account on the e-filing portal to access all tax-related services.

entertainment.headline: Ekta Kapoor cautions actors against fake audition calls for Balaji TelefilmsProducer Ekta Kapoor issued an official statement through the social media handle of Balaji Telefilms warning actors against fraudulent casting directors impersonating their staff. The alert aims to protect aspiring actors from scams and misuse of the company's name.

Harry Potter shops with Hagrid at Diagon Alley and more in new pics from HBO showThe pictures from the new 'Harry Potter' series surfaced on the internet. The upcoming show is based on the original book while also introducing new elements like the full Weasley family.

Google marks Taylor and Travis's engagement with golden hearts and diamondsTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged! Google celebrates the couple's big news with golden hearts and diamonds in search results.

Allu Arjun, Ram Charan to Mohanlal: South stars share Ganesh Chaturthi wishesSeveral South Indian stars, including Mohanlal, Allu Arjun, Ram Charan, Shiva Rajkumar, Chiranjeevi, and Sivakarthikeyan, took to social media to extend Ganesh Chaturthi greetings to their fans.

Tamil actor Lakshmi Menon named in kidnapping, assault case of IT professionalTamil actor Lakshmi Menon has been named as an accused in a kidnapping and assault case in Kochi. The incident has sparked controversy after visuals of the argument went viral and arrests were made.

Aishwarya Sharma celebrates Ganpati without Neil Bhatt, reignites separation rumoursTelevision actor Aishwarya Sharma celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi without her actor husband Neil Bhatt, fueling speculation about a possible separation. The couple fell in love on the sets of 'Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin' and married in 2021.

Amaal Mallik makes a cute confession about Shraddha Kapoor on Bigg Boss 19. WatchSinger Amaal Mallik made a confession about actor Shraddha Kapoor in 'Bigg Boss 19'. The clip is now going viral on social media and winning hearts. Mallik praised the actor's simplicity and charm and also talked about her Instagram popularity.

Govinda's wife Sunita breaks silence on divorce reports: Even God can't separate usSunita Ahuja denies rumours of divorce from actor Govinda. She emphasises their strong bond and urges privacy amid speculation.

13 times Taylor Swift manifested her engagement in songs - so high school, but trueDiscover 13 Taylor Swift songs where she quietly manifested her engagement, from 'Love Story' to 'Lover' and beyond. Swifties saw it coming all along.

Govinda, Sunita Ahuja's Ganesh Chaturthi celebration puts divorce rumours to restBollywood actor Govinda and his wife Sunita Ahuja put divorce rumours to rest as they welcomed Lord Ganpati on Wednesday. Dressed in coordinated outfits, the couple posed for paparazzi and celebrated the occasion with their son Yashvardhan.

Farhan Akhtar on playing Major Shaitan in 120 Bahadur: Rezang La heroes inspired me Actor Farhan Akhtar unveiled the teaser of '120 Bahadur', where he plays Param Vir Chakra awardee Major Shaitan Singh Bhati, honouring the bravery of 120 soldiers in the 1962 Battle of Rezang La. He said the story inspired him deeply, calling it a timeless tale of patriotism and determination.

KBC 17: Bihar contestant breaks down before Big B, recalls family strugglesIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a contestant from Bihar broke down in front of host Amitabh Bachchan. The contestant recalled his family struggles and spoke about the loss of his parents.

Singer Lil Nas X's 1st statement on arrest over cop assault, walking naked chargesSinger Lil Nas X has addressed fans after his arrest in Los Angeles, confirming he is safe. The rapper faces serious felony charges amid disputes over alleged drug use.

Malayalam actor Rajesh Keshav on ventilator support after cardiac arrest in KochiVeteran Malayalam anchor and actor Rajesh Keshav is on ventilator support after suffering a cardiac arrest during a live event in Kochi. Doctors performed an emergency angioplasty, but his condition remains critical with suspected mild brain damage.

Singer Suchitra accuses fiance of abuse: He kicked me, usurped my home, moneySinger Suchitra, in an Instagram video, claimed that she was duped by her lawyer, fiance Shunmugaraj. She claimed to have faced domestic abuse and accused him of usurping her Chennai home.

Pooja Bhatt slams Mumbai's pothole-ridden roads, calls out civic apathyPooja Bhatt criticised the worsening state of Mumbai's roads, especially in Bandra, slamming civic apathy and questioning prolonged repair work that has left potholes untouched.

Half CA 2 Review: Ahsaas's show captures exam stress but misses fresh sparkRelease Date:Wed Aug 27, 2025Half CA 2 review: Ahsaas Channa's series returns with strong performances and heartfelt moments, though its familiar plot makes it a predictable watch.

Neha Dhupia-Angad Bedi go on their first honeymoon after 8 years of marriage. PicsNeha Dhupia and Angad Bedi finally went on their first honeymoon after eight years of marriage, celebrating her birthday with a Mediterranean getaway. The actor shared stunning photos from the trip, calling it a celebration of love, family, and new beginnings.

Rahul Vaidya reacts to Virat Kohli row, says don't care about fragile relationsSinger Rahul Vaidya recently made history as he became the first artiste to perform live at the Lalbaugcha Raja Ganpati celebrations. He spoke about Maharashtrian festivities, singing regional songs, the controversy with Virat Kohli and more, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in.

general news.headline: Trade now weaponised: Raghuram Rajan calls US tariffs a wake-up call for IndiaThe 50 per cent tariffs, 25 per cent base tariffs and an additional 25 per cent duty for buying Russian oil, announced by US President Donald Trump, came into effect on Wednesday.

2 children killed, 17 injured in Minneapolis school shooting; gunman shoots selfMinnesota Governor Tim Walz posted on social media that he has been briefed about a shooting incident at the Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis.

I think we'll come together with India, says Trump aide as 50% tariffs kick inAs the US's 50 per cent tariffs on Indian goods kicked in starting today, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent described the bilateral ties as "complicated", but stressed the two countries would come together "at the end of the day".

36 dead as rain pounds J&K, Jhelum over danger mark, landslide hits Vaishno Devi YatraA landslide triggered by heavy rain claimed 36 lives and left several others injured along the Vaishno Devi Yatra route in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra. The torrential rain has triggered widespread disruption across the Union Territory.

How India's freedom struggle gifted Maharashtra its grandest festivalGanesh Chaturthi, Maharashtra's biggest festival, was transformed from a private ritual into a public celebration by freedom fighter Bal Gangadhar Tilak during India's Independence movement. His vision turned devotion into a unifying force against British rule and resulted in the festival's modern grandeur.

Day 4 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic secures comeback win in 2nd roundUS Open 2025 Day 4 Live Updates: Emma Raducanu has begun her second-round match at Louis Amstrong Stadium on a strong note. Novak Djokovic will begin action at Arthur Ashe on Wednesday against an American qualifier.

In tariff war with Trump, Modi seizes opportunity to reconnect with farmers, MSMEsTrump's 50% tariffs threaten India's farmers and MSMEs, but Modi's defiant reforms and rhetoric aim to shield them, turning a trade war into political redemption for rural India.

Impact of tariffs not as exaggerated, exports not dependent on US alone: SourcesThere are "no panic or large distress signals at all" from Indian exporters in the wake of the US tariffs, government sources said, adding that exports are "not dependent on the US alone".

CBS reporter's stunned reaction to Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce's engagement goes viralCBS News correspondent Olivia Rinaldi was caught off guard outside the White House after discovering that Taylor Swift and NFL star Travis Kelce are engaged.

Twist in Noida dowry case, victim's sister-in-law accuses Nikki's family of harassmentNikki Bhati's sister-in-law, Meenakshi, has alleged that she was harassed and assaulted over dowry demands by the victim's family, further claiming that Nikki herself also mistreated her.

Out of sync dynasts: BJP mocks Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav and MK StalinThe BJP mocked Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, calling them "out of sync dynasts" as the three leaders participated in the protest against Bihar's electoral roll exercise.

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.

Nikki's death & social media: Families flaunt dowry in reels while brides bear the bruntWhat was once whispered as 'dahej' (dowry) is now flaunted online for all to see. The law calls dowry a crime. Yet in many homes, it is still wrapped as 'riwaz' (tradition), and on Instagram reels, it often goes viral as a display of status.

Uddhav visits cousin Raj Thackeray's house for Ganesh puja after over 2 decadesThis visit is another notable moment in the reunion between the two leaders after over two decades, sparking curiosity about the potential implications for Maharashtra politics.

Did Trump just call American economy dead?After declaring both the Indian and Russian economies dead, US President Trump said the US economy was "dead" too. That was before he made it the "hottest" under his leadership. The US economy has been the world's largest since the 19th century.

Khalistani Pannun bats for Punjab-origin trucker who killed 3 in USKhalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is now defending Punjab-origin truck driver Harjinder Singh, who killed three people in Florida after making an illegal U-turn and working in the US illegally. Singh faces three counts of vehicular homicide.

From nurse to India's first woman Major-General: How Gertrude Alice Ram made historyOn August 27, 1976, Gertrude Alice Ram made history as the first woman in the Indian Army to become a Major-General. Her leadership in military nursing broke the glass ceiling an d opened doors for women across the defence forces.

Centre clears India's Commonwealth Games 2030 bid, names Ahmedabad as ideal hostThe Union Cabinet has approved India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad. This move aims to boost the country's sports profile and support its Olympic hosting ambitions.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growthThe 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

A struggling California teen asked ChatGPT for help. It showed him how to dieA California family filed a lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging that ChatGPT was to blame for their 16-year-old son's suicide. The lawsuit alleges that the chatbot acted as a "suicide coach" for their son and provided him with a "step-by-step playbook" on how to kill himself.
Video: Manali's Sher-e-Punjab washed away in floods, only entrance left standingA video going viral on social media shows the whole Sher-e-Punjab restaurant destroyed but its frontal standing intact.

Govinda's wife Sunita breaks silence on divorce reports: Even God can't separate usSunita Ahuja denies rumours of divorce from actor Govinda. She emphasises their strong bond and urges privacy amid speculation.

PV Sindhu reaches pre-quarters after 4 years, Satwik-Chirag into Round of 16BWF World Championships 2025: PV Sindhu came back from behind to beat Malaysia's Karupathevan Letshanaa in the second round. The 2019 champion will face a stern test in the pre-quarterfinals on Thursday.

US to get its first Tamil deity temple, idols sculpted in MamallapuramTexas is set to get its first Tamil Mariyamman temple, built by a Tamil couple. Idols are being sculpted in Mamallapuram. The temple will feature traditional deities and authentic Tamil festival practices.

sports.headline: No world record, but Armand Duplantis wins 5th straight Diamond League titleArmand Duplantis won the men's pole vault at the Diamond League final in Zurich, clearing 6.00m before falling short of the meet record. The Swede now owns five Diamond League titles, just two shy of the all-time record.

US Open: Novak Djokovic rolls into Round 3, equals Roger Federer's recordNovak Djokovic secured a second-round win over Zachary Svadja in the US Open men's singles competition. He will now be up against the winner between Cameron Norrie and Francisco Comesana.

Emma Raducanu into third round after 4 years, 5th seed Draper withdrawsEmma Raducanu stormed into the US Open third round with a 6-2, 6-1 win over Janice Tjen — her first deep run in New York since her 2021 title. The Brit hit 16 winners and 8 aces, while fellow Brit Jack Draper pulled out of the men's draw with injury.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi headlines PKL 12 season opener on National Sports DayPro Kabaddi League Season 12 kicks off on National Sports Day with sporting icons Pullela Gopichand, Dhanraj Pillay, Pardeep Narwal, and Vaibhav Suryavanshi uniting as kabaddi celebrates its roots with new formats and fierce rivalries.

Duleep Trophy 2025: Full squads, schedule, livestreaming details and moreThe Indian domestic season is all set to start with the Duleep Trophy starting on August 28. With the selectors keeping a keen eye on domestic performances, the players will be eager to impress during the tournament being played in Bengaluru.

Neeraj Chopra at Diamond League final: When and where to watch, all you need to knowNeeraj Chopra will return to action and aim for his second Diamond trophy as he steps onto the track against a strong lineup. Here's all you need to know about the Diamond League final event in Zurich.

Sanju Samson flexible enough to drop down batting order, says mentor Raiphi GomezFormer Kerala cricketer, Raiphi Gomez, suggested that Sanju Samson is more than flexible to bat lower down the order if the team needs it considering the return of Shubman Gill in the Asia Cup 2025 squad.

Dharambir and Preeti Pal lead India at World Para Athletics in New DelhiDharambir and Preeti Pal were named India's flag bearers for the World Para Athletics Championships. The showpiece event will be held in New Delhi from September 27 to October 5.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
